Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Address feedback from customers for the UX" (#8070) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "Published package with wrong name." (#8069) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
I have published the package TheToolBox.Data.Contracts v1.0.0 with the wrong name.
It should be TheToolbox.Data.Contracts (with lower case "b").

I contacted the support to remove the package but nothing happened.
I've tried to upload a new version (1.0.1) with the new name (after unlisting the old one) but it is still shown the old name.

Please help!!!!!

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior are available [here](https://stackoverflow.com/q/60869232/7530449)

### Screenshots
Not applied

### Additional context
Documentation [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/hosting-packages/nuget-server)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Search] Add an "Include deprecated" filter" (#8067) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
I suspect that users prefer to install the latest stable non-deprecated version of a package. Furthermore, I suspect users avoid packages if all its versions are deprecated. These are hypotheses that need to be validated.

### Describe the solution you'd like
We should consider adding an "Include deprecated" filter, similar to the "Include prerelease" filter. This would be a natural extension to the Advanced Search feature.

/cc @t-mog-msft  @chgill-MSFT  @joelverhagen

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Dependents] Polish current UI" (#8063) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Merged pull request "Don't track the package push failure if the client has disconnected" (#8060) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Address https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8022

I was unable to reproduce the issue with many wild attempts (local devbox, app service directly, APIM, custom HTTP client implementation, raising firewall in the middle of request, killing connection via external tools, etc) but from reading online this seems like the recommended implementation. See https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4772597 for some recommendations. We can't use the cancellation token approach because the API that is throwing does not accept a token. It's this line that throws:
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/84ea5890b77e79b1f218521f2c031f8ee6c311f5/src/NuGetGallery/Controllers/ApiController.cs#L984

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Dotnet master branch latest version is unavailable" (#9713) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
When running configure.ps1/runFuncTest.sh, the downloading of master branch failed as following:

```
dotnet-install: Downloading link: https://dotnetcli.azureedge.net/dotnet/Sdk/5.0.100-preview.7.20323.3/dotnet-sdk-5.0.100-preview.7.20323.3-win-x64.zip
dotnet-install: Cannot download: https://dotnetcli.azureedge.net/dotnet/Sdk/5.0.100-preview.7.20323.3/dotnet-sdk-5.0.100-preview.7.20323.3-win-x64.zip
dotnet-install: Downloading legacy link: https://dotnetcli.azureedge.net/dotnet/Sdk/5.0.100-preview.7.20323.3/dotnet-dev-win-x64.5.0.100-preview.7.20323.3.zip
dotnet-install: Cannot download: https://dotnetcli.azureedge.net/dotnet/Sdk/5.0.100-preview.7.20323.3/dotnet-dev-win-x64.5.
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Use specific other version when dotnet master branch latest version is unavailable" (#9712) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
When running configure.ps1/runFuncTest.sh, the downloading of master branch failed as following:
```
dotnet-install: Downloading link: https://dotnetcli.azureedge.net/dotnet/Sdk/5.0.100-preview.7.20323.3/dotnet-sdk-5.0.100-preview.7.20323.3-win-x64.zip
dotnet-install: Cannot download: https://dotnetcli.azureedge.net/dotnet/Sdk/5.0.100-preview.7.20323.3/dotnet-sdk-5.0.100-preview.7.20323.3-win-x64.zip
dotnet-install: Downloading legacy link: https://dotnetcli.azureedge.net/dotnet/Sdk/5.0.100-preview.7.20323.3/dotnet-dev-win-x64.5.0.100-preview.7.20323.3.zip
dotnet-install: Cannot download: https://dotnetcli.azureedge.net/dotnet/Sdk/5.0.100-preview.7.20323.3/dotnet-dev-win-x64.5.0.100-preview.7.20323.3.zip
```
We need to figure out how often the failure is.
For now, we use specific version instead of latest version.
When it's confirmed that the latest version will be available in a stable status, we should remove the workaround.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Content files not added to project (but copied to it) " (#9094) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
(Moved from: https://github.com/dotnet/project-system/issues/5316 and opened on behalf of @MaceWindu)

**Visual Studio Version**: 16.2.2

**Summary**:
Check 
[OrmTest.csrpoj](https://github.com/dotnet/project-system/files/3511749/OrmTest.txt)
project file from this [issue](https://github.com/linq2db/linq2db/issues/1865). Installing package with content files doesn't work with it properly - files are copied to project folder, but not included into project itself.

I've tried to edit project file by replacing almost everything except project guid with content of new Windows Forms project, but it didn't helped (I suspect it already broke something in solution files at this point).

**Steps to Reproduce**:

1. Open attached project

2. Reinstall linq2db.PostgreSQL nuget package


**Expected Behavior**:
Content files appeared in project under `LinqToDB.Templates` folder

**Actual Behavior**:
Content files appeared in project folder, but not in project

**User Impact**:
Confusion and anxiety

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "runtimeconfig.json file is missing when pack NuGet.Build.Tasks.Console in TFM net5.0 " (#9710) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
During insertion into dotnet/sdk, the build from dotnet side failed, complaining NuGet.Build.Tasks.Console.runtimeconfig.json missing for net5.0.
We need to include this file when packing for net5.0.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "VSOE saving package sources in tools options will overwrite credentials" (#9711) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Because we are not remoting the credentials across when we save from the dialog it will think that they were changed and overwrite the original values.

Proposed solution is to create a transactional object to save the sources that can be more configurable.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "runtimeconfig.json file is missing when pack NuGet.Build.Tasks.Console in TFM net5.0 " (#9710) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:

We need to include this file when packing for net5.0.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Output of dotnet list package --outdated, when used with VstsCredentialProvider, is very noisy" (#9709) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
When:
- using the dotnet list package --outdated command
- with a private Azure DevOps nuget feed that requires authentication, 
- and with the VstsCredentialProvider (https://github.com/Microsoft/artifacts-credprovider/) installed (from the powershell installation script)

...The output of dotnet list package is interspersed with many log instance of the same log messages: 

info :     [CredentialProvider]VstsCredentialProvider - Acquired bearer token using 'ADAL Windows Integrated Authentication'
info :     [CredentialProvider]VstsCredentialProvider - Attempting to exchange the bearer token for an Azure DevOps session token.

I can't find a way to turn these log messages off - dotnet list package doesn't appear to support any of the verbosity commands, and the configurable environment variables for the credential provider also don't appear to help.

------

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):
dotnet list package --outdated

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):
 Version:   3.1.301
 Commit:    7feb845744

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.19041
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win10-x64
 Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\3.1.301\

VstsCredentialProvider  Command-line v0.1.24+de2b62bcfccebababa9ea4099aba6c44d2f349a4:

### Verbose Logs
Can't include verbose logs as suggested, because the verbosity command doesn't appear to be supported. Screenshot of output is below: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16760146/85431214-21be2080-b579-11ea-98b0-04d22be6e255.png)

The duplicated messages appear many times (and a varying number of times, possibly waiting for a response) and between each project in the solution.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "PackageDependencyGroupConverter taking about 10% of thread runtime" (#9708) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
See screenshot, it's using JObject. Changing this one may not improve memory consumption but reduce runtime on large solutions.

[image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5eb1d84a3cd56675c3efe510/94336614-fab5-4ea5-8c8a-41bb9514b2f5)

Related to [#8352](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/8352).

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Use old NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack package in our repo will pack incorrect nupkgs" (#9707) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
In dev, we use 4.9.2 for package NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack. 
But it doesn't contain the right logic in recognizing net5.0 TFM. So the nupkgs we generated and shipped to dotnet are incorrect (treating net5.0 as full framework)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "CVE-2020-1340 - NuGet Gallery Spoofing Vulnerability" (#45) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
A spoofing vulnerability exists when the NuGet Gallery does not properly sanitize input on package metadata values. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could perform cross-site scripting attacks and run scripts in the security context of the user viewing the malicious content.

To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker with permissions to upload packages could publish specially crafted content on a gallery page.

The security update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how NuGet Gallery sanitizes input.

**MSRC Security Guidance:** [CVE-2020-1340](https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1340)
**Security Update:** [v2020.06.09](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/releases/tag/v2020.06.09)
